title: Celtic thrash Aberdeen at Pittodrie as hosts end one-sided contest without a single shot on target
text:
Aberdeen 0-4 Celtic

Celtic restated their title credentials emphatically at Pittodrie with a victory that verged on a humiliation for Aberdeen, who were four goals down at half-time in the latest chapter of a melancholy sequence that last saw them earn a home win against the Parkhe ad side in February 2016.

The Dons were overwhelmed from the start and conceded goals in steady succession to Odsonne Edouard, Jeremie Frimpong, James Forrest and finally Mohamed Elyounoussi.

The Aberdeen faithful in a crowd – at kick-off – of 15,079 were first stunned into disbelieving silence, before mustering sufficient ire to jeer their hapless players from the field at the end of each half. To make matters worse, Aberdeen had enjoyed a week free of fixtures to prepare for this match, unlike their opponents.

Neil Lennon had spoken of his disinclination to make more changes than necessary, even after a demanding occasion such as Celtic’s rousing 2-0 Europa League victory over Lazio on Thursday evening.

In the event, he had to replace Ryan Christie – serving the second instalment of a two-game suspension – with Tom Rogic, while Frimpong replaced Hatem Elhamed at right-back.
